greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = a(n-1) + a(n-3) + a(n-4) for n>3, a(0) = -1, a(1) = 1, a(2) = 2, a(3) = 1.
comment: In reference to the program code given, 4*tesseq[A*H] = A001638 (a Fielder sequence) where A001638(2n) = L(n)^2. Here we have: a(2n+1) = A007598(n+1) = Fibonacci(n+1)^2.
First bisection is A260259 (see previous comment for the second bisection). [_Bruno Berselli_, Nov 02 2015]
reference: Daniel C. Fielder, Special integer sequences controlled by three parameters. Fibonacci Quart 6, 1968, 64-70.
program: Floretion Algebra Multiplication Program, FAMP Code: 4kbaseiseq[B+H] with B = - .25'i + .25'j - .25i' + .25j' + k' - .5'kk' - .25'ik' - .25'jk' - .25'ki' - .25'kj' - .5e and H = + .75'ii' + .75'jj' + .75'kk' + .75e
results.author: _Creighton Dement_, Aug 07 2005
